description.plain:
Niall James Horan (born September 13th, 1993) is an Irish singer-songwriter, musician, and founder of Modest! Golf Management company. He auditioned on The X Factor at 16 years of age as a solo act and he came to worldwide prominence when he and four other boys were joined together to form pop boy band One Direction, which became one of the biggest boy bands in the world. Since the band’s hiatus in 2015, Horan has released two solo albums, has collaborated with the likes of Maren Morris, Julia Michaels and Ashe and has created a track for animated comedy film Smallfoot.

In September 2016, it was revealed that Niall had signed a solo contract with Capitol Records.
Following this news, Horan released his debut solo single “This Town”, becoming the first One Direction member to release solo music. “This Town” showcases his songwriting skills and vocals, as Horan strips everything down to him and his guitar. In support of the single, he also uploaded a one-take acoustic version of the single. The song peaked at No. 20 on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart on January 14th, 2017.

In May 2017, “Slow Hands”, a homage to Horan’s ‘70s and '80s classic rock influences, was released. This track peaked at No. 7 on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart on September 30th, 2017. Horan’s debut solo album Flicker was released on October 20th, 2017. It debuted on the Billboard 200 at #1, selling 152,000 copies in its first official week of sales.

Three years later, Horan released his sophomore album Heartbreak Weather, which produced four singles: “Nice to Meet Ya”,  “Put a Little Love on Me”, “No Judgement” and “Black and White”. The album debuted at the top of the Irish Albums Chart and UK Albums Chart. It also opened at number four on the US Billboard 200 with 59,000 album-equivalent units and 42,000 pure album sales. Niall held a show at Royal Albert Hall with Ashe for We Need Crew later that year.

songs.full_title: Slow Hands by Niall Horan
songs.title: Slow Hands

description.plain:
Niall Horan returns with “Slow Hands”, the second single from his solo debut album. On “Slow Hands”, Niall drifts away from the more acoustic sound of his debut solo single “This Town.” He shows his edgier and sexier side in this classic rock inspired tune following a man trying to be taken home by a forward female dance partner after a night out on the town.

Horan said in an interview with SiriusXM that this song was made in homage to his influences growing up listening to the classic rock of the ‘70s and '80s. The song was one of the last to be written for his upcoming album because as Niall put it:

I just thought, ‘You know what? I’m missing a bit of grit. Something a bit more funky, something with a bit heavier bass.

The track is produced by Julian Bunetta, a good friend of Niall’s and one of One Direction’s primary co-songwriters and producers.

“Slow Hands” has been certified Gold in the UK and 3x Platinum in the US and in Ireland.

songs.full_title: This Town by Niall Horan
songs.title: This Town

description.plain:
“This Town” is a stripped-down guitar song about still pining after an old flame. While Niall’s lover has moved on, Niall hasn’t and is still in love with them.

The song is the debut solo single from Horan, who had previously released five albums with One Direction. This marks Horan’s first solo venture after signing with Capitol Records in mid-2016.

In an interview with On Air With Ryan Seacrest (transcript), Horan stated that “This Town” was the first song written for his first solo record back in February 2016. At the time, he said that his album was about halfway done and would be released sometime in 2017.

“This Town” has been certified Gold in the UK and 2x Platinum in the US and in Ireland.

songs.full_title: Too Much to Ask by Niall Horan
songs.title: Too Much to Ask

description.plain:
“Too Much to Ask” is the third single off Niall Horan’s debut album, Flicker. In this song, Niall laments a breakup and hopes his partner regrets ending their relationship, too.  Speaking to BBC News, he said that this track was very special to him and that he hoped it’d go number #1 one day. Lost love was also a prevalent theme in the lyrics of the album’s title track, “Flicker.”

“Too Much to Ask” has been certified Gold in the UK and in the US. A music video for the song was released on September 21, 2017.

songs.full_title: Flicker by Niall Horan
songs.title: Flicker

description.plain:
“Flicker” is the title track to Niall Horan’s debut solo album, Flicker, released on October 20, 2017. It speaks from the perspective of a lover left without his loved one, as he is left clinging to any bits of hope left to him. This theme is quite common throughout Flicker, existing also in “Too Much to Ask”.

It was performed on Niall Horan’s Flicker Sessions 2017, before being released along with the rest of the Flicker album.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BUaLnDL3f-M

When you feel your love's been taken

[Chorus]
Then I think of the start
And it echoes a spark
And I remember the magic electricity
Then I look in my heart
There's a light in the dark
Still a flicker of hope that you first gave to me
That I wanna keep
Please, don't leave
Please, don't leave

And I want this to pass
And I hope this won't last
Last too long

[Chorus]
Then I think of the start
And it echoes a spark
And I remember the magic electricity
Then I look in my heart
There's a light in the dark
Still a flicker of hope that you first gave to me
That I wanna keep
Please, don't leave

songs.full_title: Nice to Meet Ya by Niall Horan
songs.title: Nice to Meet Ya

description.plain:
“Nice to Meet Ya” is the first single from Niall’s second studio album, which released on March 13th, 2020.
Niall started teasing the song in August 2019 and presented it at Capitol Congress in Los Angeles, along with the new song “Put A Little Love On Me.”
The song is described as uptempo and with vintage vibes.

The lyrics were released on September 30th, along with a challenge created by Niall: “Trying to find the beat of the song without any clue of its melody.”

description.plain:
“Put a Little Love on Me” is the second single from Niall Horan’s sophomore studio album.

The track and music video was released on December 6, 2019.

https://twitter.com/NiallOfficial/status/1202301681490227200

On Twitter, Niall said that he played around with this song in different ways by recording different vocals or sounds, but ultimately ended up sticking with the demo he recorded on the first day.

songs.full_title: Heaven by Niall Horan
songs.title: Heaven

description.plain:
“Heaven” is the lead single from Niall Horan’s third studio album, The Show, which will be released in June 2023.

The song was first teased on January 20th 2023, when some fans started receiving a package with the single’s name. On the following day, a website called heavenwontbethesame.com was launched, with the title “NH3 is loading…” and a GIF of a candle burning down. The saying “KEEP CHECKING BACK EVERY DAY” was also found in the page’s source code.

The official announcement of the single, however, was made a week after those facts, on January 26th, for the song to be released on February 17th. Since then, Horan has been teasing many parts of the song in his TikTok.

songs.full_title: Black And White by Niall Horan
songs.title: Black And White

description.plain:
In “Black and White,” Niall promises a lover that he’ll love them for the rest of his life as he portrays a wedding scenario where both he and his partner wear the common wedding dress and suit colours of black and white. Sonically, Niall highlights his vocal range as he sings over upbeat, bouncy drums and a light guitar.

The lyrics were teased on March 10, 2020, in an episode of Niall’s pre-album release series, Heartbreak Weather Watch.

songs.full_title: On the Loose by Niall Horan
songs.title: On the Loose

description.plain:
Niall Horan first performed “On The Loose” at Channel 93.3’s Summer Kick Off Concert at San Diego’s Mattress Firm Amphitheatre on May 12th, 2017. He played it for the second time at KIIS FM’s Wango Tango at LA’s StubHub Center on May 13th, 2017, only one day after he debuted “On The Loose” in San Diego.

On February 5, 2018, Niall announced that “On The Loose” would be his new single. A music video of the song was released on March 6, 2018.

In an interview to Herald Sun, Niall revealed that Fleetwood Mac was a major inspiration for this song:

You can hear the ‘Mac in that. Everyone’s always trying to write their own “Dreams”. I’m only 24, Fleetwood Mac is the music I’ve listened to since I was four years old. I listen to a lot of other types of music but that’s the stuff that always stuck around with me.

songs.full_title: Heartbreak Weather by Niall Horan
songs.title: Heartbreak Weather

description.plain:
“Heartbreak Weather” is the title track of the album, which sees Niall talk about feeling lonely and like your situation will never improve, to falling in love and going through the opening stages of a relationship.

The song and album title were revealed in the music video of “Nice to Meet Ya” where it was displayed on a poster on a street wall.

songs.full_title: Still by Niall Horan
songs.title: Still

description.plain:
“still” is the 14th track on the album “heartbreak weather”

The song “Still” by Niall Horan tells a story of a complicated and struggling relationship. The bridge suggests that the couple will be alright and that their relationship can be mended with time and effort. The chorus repeats to emphasize the importance of honesty and the truth, and the singer declares that he’s still in love with his partner.

songs.full_title: Mirrors by Niall Horan
songs.title: Mirrors

description.plain:
From Niall Horan’s debut album, Flicker, “Mirrors” is a song detailing the struggle an unnamed female protagonist is facing in which she is suffering on her own, and nobody knows what she is going through, due to her hiding behind a mask of happiness.

It was performed on Niall Horan’s Flicker Sessions 2017, before being released along with the rest of the Flicker album. At that point, it was mistaken for “I Need Love”. However, the setlist paper distributed among the fans confirmed that it is in fact “Mirrors”.

songs.full_title: No Judgement by Niall Horan
songs.title: No Judgement

description.plain:
“No Judgement” is the third single from Niall Horan’s second studio album, released on March 13th, 2020.

In the song’s music video, Niall tells us “There comes a time in the mating cycle of humans, when the need to impress is replaced by a period they call "No Judgement.” Let me tell ya something: it get’s a little bit strange."

Niall first revealed the title of the track in the music video for “Nice To Meet Ya” where it can be seen on a newspaper:

songs.full_title: On My Own by Niall Horan
songs.title: On My Own

description.plain:
Performed as the last song on Niall Horan’s tour, the Flicker Sessions 2017, “On My Own” is a song from Niall’s debut album, Flicker, talking about how he just doesn’t mind being alone, and in fact prefers it.

Niall, in fact, among the One Direction members, is almost always the bachelor, with very few public girlfriends, while the other four always had constant public relationships. Though he did not have many public romances, he valued them and his privacy.

songs.full_title: You and Me by Niall Horan
songs.title: You and Me

description.plain:
From Niall Horan’s debut album, Flicker, “You and Me” is a slow, mid-tempo song. It speaks from the perspective of a young man with an unusual way of life, who doesn’t know where he is going, but he assures the one he loves that he’ll eventually become the man he wants to be for them. And that’s all because of his faith and belief in their love.

It was performed on Niall Horan’s Flicker Sessions Tour 2017, ahead of being released along with the Flicker album.

songs.full_title: Small Talk by Niall Horan
songs.title: Small Talk

description.plain:
“Small Talk” continues the sexier theme of Heartbreak Weather single “Nice to Meet Ya” as Niall downplays small talk in favour of taking things straight to the bedroom over a groovy instrumental.

The title was revealed in the music video of “Nice to Meet Ya” where it was displayed on the top of a cab alongside a phone number which, when called, played a snippet of the track.

Horan has also said that this song was the one that took him the longest to write from Heartbreak Weather

songs.full_title: Dear Patience by Niall Horan
songs.title: Dear Patience

description.plain:
“Dear Patience”, the third song from Heartbreak Weather is all about, of course, patience.

According to an Instagram post by Niall, he wrote the song during a time period where he believed he needed to be more patient.

The song is all about taking things slow in a new, budding relationship, even if you’re wanting to jump right in and consume yourself with the person.

This song and “Heartbreak Weather” were the hardest to write on the album, according to what Niall has said in a tweet :

https://twitter.com/NiallOfficial/status/1238675796631457793

songs.full_title: Fire Away by Niall Horan
songs.title: Fire Away

description.plain:
“Fire Away,”  from Niall Horan’s debut album, Flicker, is a slow, jazz-inspired song, essentially a promise to a loved one that Niall will always be there to support them no matter how hard things get.

It was performed on Niall’s 2017 Flicker Sessions Tour before being released along with the Flicker album.

songs.full_title: The Tide by Niall Horan
songs.title: The Tide

description.plain:
“The Tide” talks about all the struggles and obstacles the protagonist feels in their rocky relationships with their loved ones, with “the tide” being the representation of everything that’s threatened to “wash away” their connection.

This track was performed by Niall Horan live in the 2017 Flicker Sessions Tour ahead of the album’s release.

songs.full_title: Cross Your Mind by Niall Horan
songs.title: Cross Your Mind

description.plain:
“Cross Your Mind” is the 10th track of Niall Horan’s second studio album, Heartbreak Weather.

The song is essentially about a hot and cold relationship. One lover being careless and reckless, not taking the other lover into consideration, leaving the other one at loss but the other lover stays because she’s too good to lose.

songs.full_title: Meltdown by Niall Horan
songs.title: Meltdown

description.plain:
“Meltdown”, is the third track on his third consecutive album, “The Show”. The single is an upbeat song about encouragement.

According to Niall via twitter the song is about “those moments where it feels like the whole world is against you. When you’re feeling anxious and being in that kind of freaking out moment but knowing deep down that everything will be alright. When I’ve felt like that myself, I know that all of you out there have felt that same way at some point too. ”

On the same tweet by Niall, he wrote the song because “I wanted to put this out there as a reminder that you’re never alone going through it.”

songs.full_title: Champagne Lovers by Niall Horan
songs.title: Champagne Lovers

description.plain:
This is an unreleased song by Niall Horan that he finished on a livestream during the 2020 pandemic lockdown. He performed this song in two Instagram livestreams: once on March 19th, 2020 and the other on May 28th, 2020.
In a livestream on September 16th, 2020, he expressed his surprise about the song by asking if fans were calling it “Champagne Lovers” and also revealed he was never planning to release it.

songs.full_title: San Francisco by Niall Horan
songs.title: San Francisco

description.plain:
“San Francisco” is Niall Horan’s nostalgic ode to a past love, which is inextricably linked in his memory to the City by the Bay. In lines ranging from Wish I hadn’t been so cruel to Take me back, take me back to San Francisco, the singer implies that his own mistake is the reason for the separation between him and San Francisco, and by extension, his loved one.

In an Instagram Live, Niall has revealed that the song is actually about San Jose but he didn’t make that the title since it seemed a little odd with the tune.

songs.full_title: Science by Niall Horan
songs.title: Science

description.plain: “Science” is an uplifting anthem encouraging listeners to persevere through tough times. With a simple yet powerful message, the song explores the human experience and the strength we possess within. The lyrics evoke emotions and self-reflection, asking poignant questions about feeling numb and yearning for change. The chorus reminds us that even when we feel like there’s nothing left, our hearts keep beating, giving us the strength to face any challenge. The song acknowledges the overwhelming nature of life’s struggles and emphasizes the importance of not letting them break us. It’s a reminder that we’re not alone and that there’s still hope to be found despite the world’s weight.

songs.full_title: You Could Start A Cult by Niall Horan
songs.title: You Could Start A Cult

description.plain: “You Could Start A Cult” expresses the artist’s unwavering devotion and willingness to sacrifice everything for their beloved. They emphasize their readiness to give up their identity and offer complete surrender. The lyrics suggest that the person they love possesses a captivating power that could inspire a following or even incite conflict among kingdoms. Despite the potential challenges and judgments they may face, the artist affirms that their love interest is far beyond mere physical beauty, holding a profound significance in their life. The song conveys an unyielding commitment to follow their loved ones until the end, regardless of the consequences.

songs.full_title: So Long by Niall Horan (Ft. RTÉ Concert Orchestra)
songs.title: So Long

description.plain:
“So Long” is a song by singer-songwriter Niall Horan. It was written for his debut album, Flicker, but didn’t make it to the final cut. However, the song was included in the setlist of Niall’s Flicker World Tour 2018.

The song would eventually be included in the orchestra version of Flicker. A live video of this version was released on February 1st, 2019.

songs.full_title: Never Grow Up by Niall Horan
songs.title: Never Grow Up

description.plain: “Never Grow Up” is a nostalgic anthem that celebrates the joy of youth and the desire to hold on to the carefree spirit of childhood. With its repetitive and catchy chorus, the song emphasizes the refusal to conform to societal expectations of maturity. The lyrics capture a longing for simplicity and genuine connections as the narrator reminisces about the innocence of past friendships and the feeling of being alive. The song envisions a future where the same excitement, passion, and playfulness are preserved, where dancing, laughter, and shared experiences remain integral to the narrator’s life. Through its lighthearted melody and relatable lyrics, “Never Grow Up” inspires listeners to embrace their inner child and hold on to the magic of youth.

songs.full_title: New Angel by Niall Horan
songs.title: New Angel

description.plain:
In “New Angel”, Niall is seeking a distraction to his current heartache. The answer? Looking for some one or something to distract him. The termination of his relationship has left him confused and ungrounded, but he’s hoping that doing something or being with somebody can help get those feelings out of his mind…at least for now.

On Twitter, Niall said that “Nothing” from the deluxe album would’ve been right after this song, had he included it in the standard version.

https://twitter.com/NiallOfficial/status/1249830338634842112?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

songs.full_title: Must Be Love by Niall Horan
songs.title: Must Be Love

description.plain: “Must Be Love” is a heartfelt song that delves into the complexities of the human mind and emotions. The song’s simple yet profound lyrics explore the singer’s tendency to overthink and analyze everything. They possess a deep understanding of their struggles and are willing to share their experiences if given the chance. The lyrics suggest a desire to escape this self-imposed prison and find solace in love. Despite their fears and insecurities, the singer acknowledges that when love feels so intense and overwhelming, there is no denying its existence. “Must Be Love” captures the essence of vulnerability, self-discovery, and the transformative power of genuine affection.

songs.full_title: If You Leave Me by Niall Horan
songs.title: If You Leave Me

description.plain: “If You Leave Me” is a heartfelt song that captures the intense longing and fear of abandonment. The lyrics depict a dreamlike encounter with a significant other, where the protagonist is left chasing them through the streets only to wake up in a daze, longing for their presence. The song expresses the fear of losing this person, acknowledging that life would lose all meaning without them. The vulnerability and depth of emotion are conveyed through the repeated plea for them to stay, as the protagonist contemplates life on their knees, unable to imagine who they would become without their love. “If You Leave Me” serves as a haunting reminder of the protagonist’s deep connection and dependence on their partner, with the desire for their love to last forever.

songs.full_title: Save My Life by Niall Horan
songs.title: Save My Life

description.plain: “Save My Life” is a captivating song that takes you on a newfound hope and love journey. With its blooming eyes and shaking floor, the lyrics paint a vivid picture of a transformative experience. The song describes a profound change as the walls start moving and the feeling shifts. The artist expresses their floating sensation, ten feet above the ground, and the magical moment when their love interest floats up to them. It’s a revelation, and they can’t help but confess that this person might have saved their life. The track captures the essence of a powerful connection, a beacon of light that brings a sense of shelter and openness. It’s an interstellar experience where the mind travels to unknown places. The lyrics convey the artist’s euphoria as they find themselves on the ceiling and revel in the sound of their name spoken by their love interest. Despite their fears, they can’t contain their gratitude for this person’s life-altering impact. The song culminates in a chorus that repeats the sentiment that this individual might have saved their life, highlighting the intensity of their longing and devotion.

songs.full_title: On A Night Like Tonight by Niall Horan
songs.title: On A Night Like Tonight

description.plain: “On A Night Like Tonight” is a passionate love song that captures the essence of a summer romance. The lyrics paint a vivid picture of desire and longing as the singer yearns for the touch of their lover’s skin against their own. The imagery of rain falling and a silver moon adds a touch of enchantment to the narrative, while the mention of heaven implies a love that feels almost divine. The song evokes a sense of wonder and curiosity as the singer contemplates the intensity of their connection and wonders what it would be like to experience it on a celestial level. With its catchy melodies and heartfelt lyrics, “On A Night Like Tonight” invites listeners to embark on a journey of love and passion, where two stars align on a magical night.

songs.full_title: Dress by Niall Horan
songs.title: Dress

description.plain:
“Dress” is the first of two Target exclusive songs on the deluxe version of Heartbreak Weather, Niall Horan’s sophomore album.

On March 13, Horan answered a question about this song on Twitter, stating that “Dress” was a personal song to him, but that it isn’t exactly a call back to “Black and White”.

songs.full_title: Fool's Gold by Niall Horan
songs.title: Fool’s Gold

description.plain:
Originally from One Direction’s fourth album, Four, Fool’s Gold is a downbeat acoustic track, discussing being used in a relationship by someone you can’t get over, or even want to.

Although One Direction’s 2015 On the Road Again Tour was dedicated to promoting and performing the entirety of the album Four, Fool’s Gold was not performed live by them in that tour. Instead, One Direction member Niall performs Fool’s Gold as part of his solo 2017 Flicker Sessions tour, beginning in August 29th, 2017 in Dublin, Ireland.

songs.full_title: Lover by Niall Horan (Ft. FLETCHER)
songs.title: Lover

description.plain:
Niall Horan recorded a pair of Spotify Singles in London, including an arena rock version of Taylor Swift’s “Lover” with help from Fletcher.

“Always love being asked to get involved in the Spotify Singles sessions. It’s nice to get out of the comfort zone and try something different. When it came to deciding what song I was going to do, there was only one option for me. ‘Lover’ is one of my favourite songs I’ve heard in a long time and Taylor is a good friend. Let’s hope she likes it.”
